summary: This document is an email chain from August 14, 2019, containing a forwarded inmate message from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The inmate, assigned to plumbing work, is in a dispute with a psychiatrist over medication side effects and compliance. The inmate's message includes angry accusations and a hope that the psychiatrist is involved in the 'negligence of Epstein' and gets fired.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The email is addressed to the Associate Warden at MCC New York, indicating they are a recipient of the forwarded inmate message regarding a medication dispute.

persons.name: Psychiatrist
persons.context: A psychiatrist at MCC New York who previously communicated with the inmate about medication non-compliance. The inmate's message is a hostile reply to this psychiatrist.

connections.description: A contentious provider-patient relationship where the inmate is refusing medication due to side effects and accusing the psychiatrist of negligence.
Implied professional relationship; the psychiatrist informs the inmate that D. is following their case.
The inmate's message is formally forwarded to the Associate Warden, indicating the warden has administrative oversight of the inmate's situation.

events.title: Inmate-Psychiatrist Medication Dispute
events.description: A psychiatrist at MCC New York sends a message to an inmate regarding their non-compliance with medication. The inmate sends an angry reply accusing the medication of causing migraines and a metallic taste, and hopes the psychiatrist is involved in 'the negligence of Epstein' and gets fired.

events.title: Message Forwarded to Associate Warden
events.description: The contentious message exchange between the inmate and psychiatrist is forwarded to the Associate Warden at MCC New York, escalating the administrative review of the incident.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is an internal prison email from August 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's death, showing inmate communications at MCC New York.
An inmate assigned to plumbing work is in a heated dispute with a prison psychiatrist over medication side effects and compliance.
The inmate's message explicitly references 'the negligence of Epstein,' directly connecting their personal grievance to the Epstein case and the scrutiny surrounding his death in custody.
The communication protocol requires messages to be sent from a departmental mailbox, not a personal one, to reach the inmate, highlighting institutional procedures.
The inmate's work assignment is listed as 'PLUMBING,' providing context about their status and activities within the correctional facility.
